entry.title: Revert "Validate that imported functions exist on oldest Windows version"
entry.content:
This reverts commit c2c0b1c9df8c56c6e3010a8b71268b805d6e2e7f.



Reason for revert: asan failures https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/win-asan/b8767602235053406401/overview



Original change's description:

> Validate that imported functions exist on oldest Windows version

>

> Chromium supports Windows versions back to 10.0.10240. If a new

> non-delayloaded import is added to chrome.exe, chrome_elf.dll or

> chrome.dll and that function isn't exported by the related system

> dll on Windows 10240 then chrome will not load.

>

> This CL adds new tests to the delayloads_unittests target that

> take the required imports for the above modules and validate that

> they are listed as exports on a specimen Windows 10.0.10240

> system.

>

> To allow for upgrades in future we generate the C++ structure

> needed as import from the output of the dumpbin /exports command.

>

entry.title: Reland "[build] Add node binary to inputs in node template"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 021a5b663146baa94efc9b4b027bf09e278ea37c.



Reason for revert: The initial land broke Win cross compile from

Linux host because node.exe doesn't exit.



```

ninja: Entering directory `out/win-rel'

[0/1] Regenerating ninja files

ninja: error: '../../third_party/node/win/node.exe', needed by 'gen/ui/webui/resources/tsc/cr_elements/cr_tab_box/cr_tab_box.js', missing and no known rule to make it

```



This reland fixes the GN conditions to not require Win/Mac node binaries

on Linux host.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[build] Add node binary to inputs in node template"

>

> This reverts commit 5e48ece8f58865e0e5d141cff6613acc8b73af3e.

entry.title: apple: Stop passing -fobjc-call-cxx-dtors
entry.content:
Way back when, in gcc this was needed to call C++ destructors when

Objective-C++ objects containing C++ classes get destroyed.



But as far as I can tell, this flag has been a no-op in clang ever

since it was added: https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/c790b09b8

and we've been passing this needlessly to clang for the last 12 years.



No behavior change.



Bug: none

Change-Id: I514f67c32d4eada7fd5e1cca7194713fe12a482a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4929988

Reviewed-by: Mark Mentovai

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1208043}

entry.title: frame: Flip fullscreen state on TabletModeToggled
entry.content:
This CL fixes the behavior for both Ash and Lacros when entering tablet

mode while immersive mode is enabled.



Currently, immersive mode state is tied to fullscreen state since

FullscreenController::ToggleBrowserFullscreenMode() eventually calls

ImmersiveModeController::SetEnabled to align the state.

However, OnTabletModeToggled only updates immersive mode state while

it does not for fullscreen state. This causes the incorrect state

where fullscreen is still enabled while tablet mode is enabled so

that the tablet mode feature such as swiping down/up is unusable.



Locked fullscreen is the only exception where immersive and fullscreen

mode may have different states. In such case, both was_enabled and

ShouldEnableImmersiveModeController() must be false, so it won't break

the locked fullscreen state. This behavior is verified by

LockedFullscreenBrowserNonClientFrameViewChromeOSTest.ToggleTabletMode



This CL lets FullscreenController toggles fullscreen mode instead of

only updating immersive mode.



Bug: 1362916

Change-Id: I8636006edbb152099eb7a65bbc290a76f6732170

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4916673

Commit-Queue: Eriko Kurimoto

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1208040}

entry.title: paint: rework vertical geometry handling in text painting code
entry.content:
Derived from by dazabani@igalia.com:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4417337



When painting text fragments in vertical writing modes, we rotate the

canvas into a line-relative coordinate space, where +x is line-right

and +y is line-under. Some paint ops (like text and decorations) are

done in this rotated space, while others (like selection backgrounds)

are done in the original physical space.



We previously used the PhysicalRect family of types for both of these

coordinate spaces, because their interfaces are essentially the same

if you treat “left” as line-left and so on. This is quite error-prone,

forcing us to rely on comments (“in logical direction”) and naming

conventions (FooInPhysicalSpace, FooInWritingModeSpace, ForForeground,

physical_foo, rotated_foo) to avoid mixing coordinate spaces.



This patch introduces two new geometry types (LineRelativeOffset,

LineRelativeRect) to represent such coordinates in a type-safe way.

They are based on PhysicalRect, but you can think of

them as gfx::RectF and friends but fixed-point (LayoutUnit).



TextPainterBase::Rotation is moved to a member function of

LineRelativeRect, with a new explanatory comment that also helps explain why a LineOrientedRect at the box origin can be rotated by swapping

width and height only.



Bug: 1147859

Change-Id: Ibf7c263d5e55498864925454eb1063c450d0aac0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4736694

Reviewed-by: Stephen Chenney

Commit-Queue: Stephen Chenney

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1208023}

entry.title: Client side changes for UnaffiliatedDeviceArcAllowed
entry.content:
Change to check value of policy 'UnaffiliatedDeviceArcAllowed' and decide if Arc should be allowed or not on Unaffiliated devices. If the value of UnaffiliatedDeviceArcAllowed is true then Arc is allowed on Unaffiliated devices but if the value is false then Arc is not allowed on unaffiliated devices.



Test: gn gen out_Default/Release --args='target_os="chromeos"'

Test: autoninja -C out_Default/Release unit_tests

Test: ./out_Default/Release/unit_tests

--gtest_filter='ChromeUnaffiliatedDevicesArcRestrictionTest*'

Test: Tested manually with policy value true and false in the following cases

1. affiliated, unaffiliated and non enterprise user on an enrolled device.

2. managed and unmanaged user on an unenrolled device.

To override the policy value follow

go/arc-policies#2-create-a-file-with-policy

for steps on how to create a file with policy.

entry.title: [Extensions] Fix printing.submitJob promise crash
entry.content:
This CL adds in a test for an MV3 extension calling printing.submitJob

using a promise based call and modifies the related hooks delegate case

to allow for this situation.



It's not ideal to have to rely on custom hooks to handle this logic

themselves, but this at least gets the promise based call for this

API working for now.



Note: There are no CQ builders that properly run this test as it

requires a chromeos builder with "use_cups = true". It has been tested

locally on a build with those args using the browser_tests target and

--gtest_filter="Printing*ApiTest.*"

entry.title: Rewrite program completion map in terms of GC'd data structures.
entry.content:
Since there is no HeapLinkedHashMap yet, maintain the program

completion query map with a combined HeapHashMap mapping programs to

their completion queries, and a HeapVector which maintains the

ordering of additions to the map.



Stress this revised code path with an enhancement to the

KHR_parallel_shader_compile conformance test

https://github.com/KhronosGroup/WebGL/pull/3597 .



Verified (via printfs, while running the new test) that the lookups

using Member are working as expected.

entry.title: Update menu location code for macOS 14
entry.content:
macOS 14 rebuilt menus from scratch, making the SPI we relied on

not reliable. All the accessibility accessors were wired up to the

new implementation, so switch to using those instead.



This also cleans up the pre-macOS 14 code, as it’s found to be

reliable as is. This specifically removes the access from the

block backwards to the _anchorRect, as that created a retain loop and

caused leaking of all of these objects.



Fixed: 1490677

entry.content:
This is a reland of commit e73197d2d6f0bffe96c36c17eeb42afb5fd7936b



Release build failed to compile due to DVLOGF being compiled out.

This resulted in |log_level| being assigned, but not used.



Change logging to be tolerant of release builds.

> v4l2/stateless: Cleanup ioctl error reporting

entry.title: arc: Add UnaffiliatedDeviceArcAllowed policy
entry.content:
This is a user policy used to allow/disallow ARC on unaffiliated

devices.

Setting UnaffiliatedDeviceArcAllowed to True allows managed user

to use ARC on unaffiliated devices.

Setting it to False means a managed user can't use ARC on

unaffiliated devices.

This policy only applies if UnaffiliatedArcAllowed and

ArcEnabled are both true.

The order of precedence is ArcEnabled >

UnaffiliatedArcAllowed(device policy) >

UnaffiliatedDeviceArcAllowed(new user policy).



Why a new policy? UnaffiliatedArcAllowed is applied at the device

level on managed ChromeOS devices but we want to restrict access

at the user level.

UnaffiliatedDeviceArcAllowed is more restrictive than ArcEnabled

since it also checks device affiliation.



Test: Manually test on DUT and checked the policy value on chrome://policy.

Override the policy value by adding {"UnaffiliatedDeviceArcAllowed":false, }

using "sudo vim /etc/opt/chrome/policies/managed/test_policy.json".

Follow go/arc-policies#2-create-a-file-with-policy

for steps on how to create a file with policy



Bug: b:287334721

entry.content:
The WebAuthn "prf" extension supports evaluating a credential's PRF

during its creation. However, the CTAP2-level "hmac-secret" extension

does not support this. Since there were no devices that could do it,

that WebAuthn feature wasn't wired up.



However, it's possible for hybrid devices to support this feature so

this change wires it up from the renderer to the device code.

entry.title: Use DocumentToken in PrefetchContainer::Key
entry.content:
`PrefetchService::prefetch_ready_to_serve_` has been

partially working to make PrefetchContainers Document-scoped,

by requiring going through via per-Document

`PrefetchDocumentManager::DidStartNavigation()`,

but this mechanism is to be removed in [1].



Instead, this CL keeps PrefetchContainers matching

still Document-scoped even after [1],

by turning `PrefetchContainer::Key` from

GlobalRenderFrameHostId-based into Document-based.



This CL plumbs `blink::DocumentToken`

instead of `WeakDocumentPtr` or `GlobalRenderFrameHostId`

through `NavigationRequest` -> `NavigationRequestInfo`

-> `NavigationURLLoaderImpl` -> `PrefetchURLLoaderInterceptor`.



As a result, this CL also fixes crbug.com/1431804 and

removes a dependency to the initiator liveness.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4917444





Bug: 1431387, 1431804, 1448731, 1432886

entry.title: Fix for prefers-color-scheme media query bug in High Contrast mode
entry.content:
This CL fixes a bug where the prefers-color-scheme media query returns

the wrong value for High Contrast themes in WebUI. The expected

behavior is that the media query should return 'dark' for dark high

contrast themes and 'light' for light high contrast themes. However,

the media query always returns 'light' regardless of the high contrast

theme.



The root cause of this bug is that the media query value for WebUI is

derived from the ColorMode of the ColorProvider associated with the web

content. This field is only set to dark if the return value of

NativeTheme::GetDefaultColorScheme is kDark. However, the method

returns kPlatformHighContrast in high contrast mode, which ultimately

causes the ColorMode to be set to kLight in all cases.



To fix this bug, this CL uses a switch statement to handle all cases

appropriately. In the case where the ColorScheme is

kPlatformHighContrast, we use NativeTheme::GetPreferredColorScheme to

get the right ColorMode.



Bug: 1479359

Change-Id: I10cc72f6d4fd319bc7ddf86df6df3d84e8cb2829

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4912444

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

entry.title: Correct audio sound break.
entry.content:
Audio sound is broken when it playes on the mp4 muxer. The

root cause is invalid track order after the first fragment

because the code simply adds track without checking its

audio or video index. The change correct this and

also fix simply code bug of passing 'false' instead of

'true' for audio in the AdjustTimestamp.

entry.title: [Fixit] Fix app crash observed when a window with no tabs is closed
entry.content:
Validate the selected tab index in UndoRefocusHelper's

TabModelSelectorTabModelObserver#willCloseAllTabs implementation before

invoking maybeSetSelectedTabId() to avoid the NullPointerException

observed on the tab, as reported in the linked bug. The selected tab

will be null when this observer method is invoked when the app window

being closed already contains no tabs.

entry.title: Treat color space changes as config changes.
entry.content:
It turns out some decoding pipelines don't reliably support just

evicting picture buffers. We need to actual go through a full

reset of the underlying decoder to avoid issues.



This removes the kColorSpaceChange constant and adds a feature

flag controlling the usage of color space changes (enabled by

default).

entry.title: IndexedDB: add flag for changing default IDB transaction durability
entry.content:
Note that this only affects readwrite transactions created via

`IDBDatabase.transaction`. The following are NOT affected:



* For "read" transactions, the flush param is ignored;

see `LevelDBScope::Commit`

* The transaction for a version change

operation is always strict; see `OpenRequest::StartUpgrade`.

* The transaction for deleting a database is always relaxed;

see `IndexedDBBackingStore::DeleteDatabase`

* Various internal operations like database upgrades or

initialization use LevelDBDirectTransaction/

TransactionalLevelDBDatabase which hard codes syncing to

true (see kSyncWrites)



Bug: 965883

Change-Id: Ida072dc6cc3908a37a06277c7926d267c9969ca2

entry.title: Reduce the cost of offset mapping for pseudo highlights
entry.content:
Previously, every offset for every highlight was recomputed

from scratch, failing to make use of the sorted markers.

This change adds a class to process offsets making use of the

sorted array, by storing the last seen offset and searching

forward in the array from there.



Patch originally contributed by fs@opera and only slightly

modified.

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4506780

raw_span<> provides both the spatial safety of span<> and the

temporal safety of raw_ptr<>.

entry.title: Measure the memory usage of various associative containers.
entry.content:
The measurement system consists of two parts:

- A C++ test binary that uses a scoper to log allocations and frees

while inserting entries into maps.

- A python3 script to postprocess the results into something usable.



It is possible to implement an all-in-one binary, but it adds

significant complexity. The allocator hooks used by the logger are

synchronnously dispatched during allocation, so the logger cannot

dynamically allocate memory.



The logger could use statically-sized buffers, and use the scoper's

destructor to flush the buffers to a more structured format, but it

would not eliminate the need for postprocessing.



Bug: 1121345

Change-Id: I9f2a5fea79398d0c86c0905dde8233f1be24093c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3956287

entry.title: Use screen coordinates in NotificationViewBaseTest
entry.content:
macOS Sonoma changed the default new window position, which broke these

tests. Event generator's `MoveMouseTo` expects screen coordinates, but

we were passing view coordinates. This was succeeding by accident in

previous versions of macOS because the mouse ended up in

NotificationControlButtonsView which doesn't claim mouse events, so

they were bubbled up to the base view.

entry.title: pip2: Allow capture from a document picture-in-picture window
entry.content:
This CL re-enables the ability for document picture-in-picture pages

to request desktop capture. It was previously disabled since the

capture dialog clipped strangely on some platforms, but that issue is

fixed so we can now re-enable this.



Note that this changes nothing about whether or not a document

picture-in-picture page can *be captured*, just whether or not it can

request capture of the screen and open the capture dialog inside the

picture-in-picture window.

entry.title: [SurfacePolish] Fix feeds header in narrow window on tablets.
entry.content:
In this CL, we make the following 2 changes:

1) FeedSurfaceMediator be an observer of UiConfig, and adjust the

layout parameter of Feeds header when the window becomes narrow in

tablets.

2) Call mUiConfig.updateDisplayStyle() in NTP when mUiConfig is first

available rather than every time when on NTP is visible. This

prevents multiple call of updateDisplayStyle() when the display

style isn't changed.

Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/szBJhaC3pCuJaFL

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AgSeYPEHVSei6Aq

Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oLmMhyFlQzvxqc5np79j4n6KP2afuQsG/view?usp=drive_link

entry.title: [editing] `PositionOutsideTabSpan` returns the position of a sibling node when the `anchor_node` has a sibling node
entry.content:
When inserting text, the corresponding position is within the TabSpan,

and the insertion position will directly skip over the TabSpan.

Consider this test case:





hello





Place the cursor before the 'h' and type the letter 'a',

'a' will be inserted after TabSpan, renderer as:

helloa

helloa



This patch allows that `PositionOutsideTabSpan` to return the

position of a sibling node when the `anchor_node` has a sibling node.

entry.title: [AssistData] Add static tree dump tests for AssistData on Android
entry.content:
This CL updates the existing WebContentsAccessibilityTreeTest to

include a test of the ViewStructure (AssistData) for each test.



With this CL we add to the existing test suite to make it run the

currently existing test, and then an additional test of the

ViewStructure for each test. The two structures (ViewStructure vs.

AccessibilityNodeInfo tree) are constructed inside the same

test to minimize overhead. If the AccessibilityNodeInfo tree portion

of the test fails, then the ViewStructure portion will not be run.

The ViewStructure portion can fail even after the ANI portion

passed.



This CL sets up the structure and adds four tests as a proof of

concept. The remaining tests will be added with follow-up CLs.



AX-Relnotes: N/A

Bug: 303655535
